JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
As the Plant Manager for LiqTech Operations Site Ballerup, you will play a central role in the company. You will become part of the LiqTech Management Team, working in close collaboration across three locations with the company’s CEO, CFO, and the rest of the team of talented managers.

You will have the organizational responsibility for Operations Site Ballerup, covering Production, Supply Chain, and the Technical Department. This position requires that you have the ability and desire to lead and motivate the employees at Operations Site Ballerup, so they are always focused on sustainable business, quality, process optimization, and profitability.

At LiqTech, we provide the world with an environmentally important and technologically unique product:  a product that we are proud of and in which we possess extensive expertise in manufacturing.

The focus for the LiqTech Plant Manager – in our chemical operations – is to stabilize and optimize our production operations. In other words, success in the job means you must ensure the establishment of a well-thought-out, efficient, sustainable, scalable, and profitable production setup and operation in all facets of the value chain.

Your responsibilities and primary tasks will be to:

  • Devise action plans for, and ensure follow-up on, activities that support the company’s budget target, other KPIs and the development strategy.
  • Identify and drive improvement projects that ensure continuous performance improvements.
  • Manage the overall quality assurance, safety program, and financial management in operations.
  • Actively help with the digitalization of the production processes and procedures.
  • Exchange/sound out ideas with your skilled team, which supports the factory’s multidisciplinary development.
  • Be an active link between the company and other departments and locations – including in particular, Sales and R&D, which are central functions that support all LiqTech Operations Sites. Lead the way in effective, direct, and strong collaborative relations.
  • Prepare all relevant reports for the rest of the management, Finance, investors and/or stakeholders.
  • Participate in strategically important meetings with current and potential customers.

 

 

Your profile

In a dynamic daily working environment, where flexibility and a high level of customer service requires hands-on engagement and strong oversight, you are able to see the optimization possibilities in individual projects, deliverables and processes.

Professional qualifications

  • You have concrete experience from a similar production company and at an equivalent management level.
  • Your career path most likely started from a technical background, e.g., as a qualified engineer, though this is not crucial.
  • You are experienced in production optimization and ideally in automation projects.
  • If you have supplemented your technical education with a relevant business administration and management education, this will be an advantage.
  • Specific and documented project management experience and ideally experience in Lean or other process/flow optimization.
  • High level of proficiency in IT and English (spoken and written).

 

Your management style is characterized by an easily approachable manner, hands-on engagement, team spirit and open and clear communication.

You possess business acumen, are results-oriented and focus on optimization, all of which enable you to inspire your colleagues to try new methods, tools, and methods of working. In general, your positive, inquisitive, authentic, and appreciative approach with other people is one of your major strengths.

 

Apply

If you think you would be an excellent match for this position and you would like to join our company, then send your CV, which must emphasize your motivation for the position. Please upload your CV via this link (NB: we receive only applications via the link).

Your CV must be written in English since your immediate superior is an English speaker.

We are very busy and would love to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so we will hold interviews on an ongoing basis, and the position will be filled as soon as we have found the right candidate.

If you have any questions relating to the position’s details and tasks, then please contact VP HR Rikke Holgersen Feld, by telephone at +45 29 26 09 63/e-mail at rhf@liqtech.com or CEO Alexander J. Buehler by e-mail at abu@liqtech.com (in English).

For over two decades LiqTech has developed and supplied high-tech solutions in exhaust gas and water treatment by using revolutionary ceramic silicon carbide (SiC) filters and membranes.

LiqTech is listed on Nasdaq in New York and operates at three different locations in Denmark – Ballerup, Hobro and Risskov.
